segment.source: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise (Windows 10)
segment.target: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise (Windows 10)

segment.source: A device in kiosk mode runs a specified app with no access to other device functions, menus, or settings.
segment.target: A device in kiosk mode runs a specified app with no access to other device functions, menus, or settings.

segment.source: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise
segment.target: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: A device in kiosk mode runs a specified app with no access to other device functions, menus, or settings.
segment.target: A device in kiosk mode runs a specified app with no access to other device functions, menus, or settings.

segment.source: You configure a device running Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise for kiosk mode by using the Apps Corner feature.
segment.target: You configure a device running Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise for kiosk mode by using the Apps Corner feature.

segment.source: You can also use the Enterprise Assigned Access configuration service provider (CSP) to configure a kiosk experience.
segment.target: You can also use the Enterprise Assigned Access configuration service provider (CSP) to configure a kiosk experience.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The specified app must be an above lock screen app.
segment.target: The specified app must be an above lock screen app.

segment.source: For details on building an above lock screen app, see Kiosk apps for assigned access: Best practices.
segment.target: For details on building an above lock screen app, see Kiosk apps for assigned access: Best practices.

segment.source: Apps Corner
segment.target: Apps Corner

segment.source: Apps Corner lets you set up a custom Start screen on your Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise device, where you can share only the apps you choose with the people you let use your device.
segment.target: Apps Corner lets you set up a custom Start screen on your Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise device, where you can share only the apps you choose with the people you let use your device.

segment.source: You configure a device for kiosk mode by selecting a single app to use in Apps Corner.
segment.target: You configure a device for kiosk mode by selecting a single app to use in Apps Corner.

segment.source: To set up Apps Corner
segment.target: To set up Apps Corner

segment.source: On Start start, swipe over to the App list, then tap SettingssettingsAccountsApps Corner.
segment.target: On Start start, swipe over to the App list, then tap SettingssettingsAccountsApps Corner.

segment.source: Tap Apps, tap to select the app that you want people to use in the kiosk mode, and then tap done
segment.target: Tap Apps, tap to select the app that you want people to use in the kiosk mode, and then tap done

segment.source: If your phone doesn't already have a lock screen password, you can set one now to ensure that people can't get to your Start screen from Apps Corner.
segment.target: If your phone doesn't already have a lock screen password, you can set one now to ensure that people can't get to your Start screen from Apps Corner.

segment.source: Tap Protect my phone with a password, click Add, type a PIN in the New PIN box, type it again in the Confirm PIN box, and then tap OK.
segment.target: Tap Protect my phone with a password, click Add, type a PIN in the New PIN box, type it again in the Confirm PIN box, and then tap OK.

segment.source: Press Backback to the Apps Corner settings.
segment.target: Press Backback to the Apps Corner settings.

segment.source: Turn Action center on or off, depending on whether you want people to be able to use these features when using the device in kiosk mode.
segment.target: Turn Action center on or off, depending on whether you want people to be able to use these features when using the device in kiosk mode.

segment.source: Tap advanced, and then turn features on or off, depending on whether you want people to be able to use them.
segment.target: Tap advanced, and then turn features on or off, depending on whether you want people to be able to use them.

segment.source: Press Backback when you're done.
segment.target: Press Backback when you're done.

segment.source: To use Apps Corner
segment.target: To use Apps Corner

segment.source: On Start start, swipe over to the App list, then tap SettingssettingsAccountsApps Corner launch launch.
segment.target: On Start start, swipe over to the App list, then tap SettingssettingsAccountsApps Corner launch launch.

segment.source: Tip
segment.target: Tip

segment.source: Want to get to Apps Corner with one tap?
segment.target: Want to get to Apps Corner with one tap?

segment.source: In Settings, tap Apps Cornerpin to pin the Apps Corner tile to your Start screen.
segment.target: In Settings, tap Apps Cornerpin to pin the Apps Corner tile to your Start screen.

segment.source: Give the device to someone else, so they can use the device and only the one app you chose.
segment.target: Give the device to someone else, so they can use the device and only the one app you chose.

segment.source: When they're done and you get the device back, press and hold Power
segment.target: When they're done and you get the device back, press and hold Power

segment.source: power
segment.target: power

segment.source: , and then swipe right to exit Apps Corner.
segment.target: , and then swipe right to exit Apps Corner.

segment.source: Enterprise Assigned Access
segment.target: Enterprise Assigned Access

segment.source: Enterprise Assigned Access allows you to lock down your Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise device in kiosk mode by creating a user role that has only a single app, set to run automatically, in the Allow list.
segment.target: Enterprise Assigned Access allows you to lock down your Windows 10 Mobile or Windows 10 Mobile Enterprise device in kiosk mode by creating a user role that has only a single app, set to run automatically, in the Allow list.

segment.source: Note The app can be a Universal Windows app, Universal Windows Phone 8 app, or a legacy Silverlight app.
segment.target: Note The app can be a Universal Windows app, Universal Windows Phone 8 app, or a legacy Silverlight app.

segment.source: Set up Enterprise Assigned Access in MDM
segment.target: Set up Enterprise Assigned Access in MDM

segment.source: In AssignedAccessXml, for Application, you enter the product ID for the app to run in kiosk mode.
segment.target: In AssignedAccessXml, for Application, you enter the product ID for the app to run in kiosk mode.

segment.source: Find product IDs at Product IDs in Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: Find product IDs at Product IDs in Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: See the technical reference for the Enterprise Assigned Access configuration service provider (CSP).
segment.target: See the technical reference for the Enterprise Assigned Access configuration service provider (CSP).

segment.source: Set up assigned access using Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)
segment.target: Set up assigned access using Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)

segment.source: To create and apply a provisioning package for a kiosk device
segment.target: To create and apply a provisioning package for a kiosk device

segment.source: Create an AssignedAccess.xml file that specifies the app the device will run.
segment.target: Create an AssignedAccess.xml file that specifies the app the device will run.

segment.source: (You can name use any file name.) For instructions on AssignedAccessXml, see EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP.
segment.target: (You can name use any file name.) For instructions on AssignedAccessXml, see EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Do not escape the xml in AssignedAccess.xml file as Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) will do that when building the package.
segment.target: Do not escape the xml in AssignedAccess.xml file as Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) will do that when building the package.

segment.source: Providing escaped xml in Windows ICD will cause building the package fail.
segment.target: Providing escaped xml in Windows ICD will cause building the package fail.

segment.source: Open Windows ICD (by default, %windir%Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitImaging and Configuration Designerx86ICD.exe).
segment.target: Open Windows ICD (by default, %windir%Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitImaging and Configuration Designerx86ICD.exe).

segment.source: Choose New provisioning package.
segment.target: Choose New provisioning package.

segment.source: Name your project, and click Next.
segment.target: Name your project, and click Next.

segment.source: Choose Common to all Windows mobile editions and click Next.
segment.target: Choose Common to all Windows mobile editions and click Next.

segment.source: On New project, click Finish.
segment.target: On New project, click Finish.

segment.source: The workspace for your package opens.
segment.target: The workspace for your package opens.

segment.source: Expand Runtime settingsEmbeddedLockdownProfiles, and click AssignedAccessXml.
segment.target: Expand Runtime settingsEmbeddedLockdownProfiles, and click AssignedAccessXml.

segment.source: Click Browse to select the AssignedAccess.xml file.
segment.target: Click Browse to select the AssignedAccess.xml file.

segment.source: On the File menu, select Save.
segment.target: On the File menu, select Save.

segment.source: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.
segment.target: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.

segment.source: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.
segment.target: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.
segment.target: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.

segment.source: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.
segment.target: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.

segment.source: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.
segment.target: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.

segment.source: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.
segment.target: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.

segment.source: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.
segment.target: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.

segment.source: By default, Windows ICD uses the project folder as the output location.
segment.target: By default, Windows ICD uses the project folder as the output location.

segment.source: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.
segment.target: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Click Build to start building the package.
segment.target: Click Build to start building the package.

segment.source: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.
segment.target: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.

segment.source: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.
segment.target: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.

segment.source: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.
segment.target: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.

segment.source: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.
segment.target: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.

segment.source: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.
segment.target: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.

segment.source: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.
segment.target: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.

segment.source: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.
segment.target: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.

segment.source: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.
segment.target: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.

segment.source: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.
segment.target: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.

segment.source: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: Select the output location link to go to the location of the package.
segment.target: Select the output location link to go to the location of the package.

segment.source: You can distribute that .ppkg to mobile devices using any of the following methods:
segment.target: You can distribute that .ppkg to mobile devices using any of the following methods:

segment.source: Removable media (USB/SD)
segment.target: Removable media (USB/SD)

segment.source: To apply a provisioning package from removable media
segment.target: To apply a provisioning package from removable media

segment.source: Copy the provisioning package file to the root directory on a micro SD card.
segment.target: Copy the provisioning package file to the root directory on a micro SD card.

segment.source: On the device, insert the micro SD card containing the provisioning package.
segment.target: On the device, insert the micro SD card containing the provisioning package.

segment.source: Go to SettingsAccountsProvisioning.
segment.target: Go to SettingsAccountsProvisioning.

segment.source: Tap Add a package.
segment.target: Tap Add a package.

segment.source: On the Choose a method screen, in the Add from dropdown menu, select Removable Media.
segment.target: On the Choose a method screen, in the Add from dropdown menu, select Removable Media.

segment.source: Select a package will list all available provisioning packages on the micro SD card.
segment.target: Select a package will list all available provisioning packages on the micro SD card.

segment.source: Tap the desired package, and then tap Add.
segment.target: Tap the desired package, and then tap Add.

segment.source: You will see a message that tells you what the package will do the device, such as Adding it will: Lock down the user interface.
segment.target: You will see a message that tells you what the package will do the device, such as Adding it will: Lock down the user interface.

segment.source: Tap Yes, add it.
segment.target: Tap Yes, add it.

segment.source: Restart the device and verify that the runtime settings that were configured in the provisioning package were applied to the device.
segment.target: Restart the device and verify that the runtime settings that were configured in the provisioning package were applied to the device.

segment.source: Email
segment.target: Email

segment.source: To apply a provisioning package sent in email
segment.target: To apply a provisioning package sent in email

segment.source: Send the provisioning package in email to an account on the device.
segment.target: Send the provisioning package in email to an account on the device.

segment.source: Open the email on the device, and then double-tap the attached file.
segment.target: Open the email on the device, and then double-tap the attached file.

segment.source: You will see a message that tells you what the package will do the device, such as Adding it will: Lock down the user interface.
segment.target: You will see a message that tells you what the package will do the device, such as Adding it will: Lock down the user interface.

segment.source: Tap Yes, add it.
segment.target: Tap Yes, add it.

segment.source: Restart the device and verify that the runtime settings that were configured in the provisioning package were applied to the device.
segment.target: Restart the device and verify that the runtime settings that were configured in the provisioning package were applied to the device.

segment.source: USB tether (mobile only)
segment.target: USB tether (mobile only)

segment.source: To apply a provisioning package using USB tether
segment.target: To apply a provisioning package using USB tether

segment.source: Connect the device to your PC by USB.
segment.target: Connect the device to your PC by USB.

segment.source: Select the provisioning package that you want to use to provision the device, and then drag and drop the file to your device.
segment.target: Select the provisioning package that you want to use to provision the device, and then drag and drop the file to your device.

segment.source: The provisioning package installation dialog will appear on the phone.
segment.target: The provisioning package installation dialog will appear on the phone.

segment.source: You will see a message that tells you what the package will do the device, such as Adding it will: Lock down the user interface.
segment.target: You will see a message that tells you what the package will do the device, such as Adding it will: Lock down the user interface.

segment.source: Tap Yes, add it.
segment.target: Tap Yes, add it.

segment.source: Restart the device and verify that the runtime settings that were configured in the provisioning package were applied to the device.
segment.target: Restart the device and verify that the runtime settings that were configured in the provisioning package were applied to the device.

segment.source: Learn how to apply a provisioning package in audit mode or OOBE.
segment.target: Learn how to apply a provisioning package in audit mode or OOBE.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Set up a kiosk on Windows 10 Pro, Enterprise, or Education
